doc.repnme: Urban water supply and sanitation : a community-based approach in Ethiopia
doc.abstracts: The Community-Based Water and Sanitation Program (COBWAS) poses a simple and interesting question. In the face of the inability of local authorities to provide safe water and sanitation services, can communities in a major African city effectively take control of their own service provision? COBWAS is an ambitious attempt to upgrade the water supply and sanitation services in Addis Ababa, capital city of Ethiopia, by encouraging local communities to design, and implement, action plans for their own areas. High priority is placed on low-cost, appropriate technology solutions. COBWAS is at an early stage of its development and although no results are as yet available, the scheme has already involved a high degree of cooperation between international agencies, local government, and other groups within the city. This Field Note reports on the key ideas of an initiative quite unique in the Ethiopian environment.
